challenge
the school of government is Oxford

aims to improve government they really
were interested in creating spaces and

fostering cooperation and really kind of
get disposability so that the people

that's quite amazing to be able to learn
from other people's experiences we
started in a very primitive way this
idea of having an internal forum space
really like a heart like a campfire
almost you know everything was around
that central space for us was very

Oxford of this so dramatically
interesting pattern it would continue
this year in this master plan as well
it's picked up a whole lot of very
classical features of Oxford it's got
those shapes of the Sheldonian quite
consciously each of the glass panels has
a certain spacing and that spacing is
actually exactly the same as the spacing
of the stone facade of the ancient
Bodley and library that very beautiful
honey colored stone is the colour of
Oxford stone and it's been fashioned in
that lovely double rounded stone work
which reflects the most lovely classical
finishings around Oxford buildings it
picks up some of the very best of Oxford
and takes it forward so you enter the
building under this two-story overhang
think it's important that the building
kind of embraces you almost it opens up
the wings to welcome you when you enter
you can look up into this what we call
the window to the world which is a huge
window which basically is the window for
the students to look out onto the street
and for people entering the building to
see the students the activity inside of
the buildings you ever brought they are
bringing you down into the lower level
the lower level houses all the lecture
theatres and seminar rooms the first
three floors are basically the teaching
floors in these spaces we made the
stairs following the form of the Forum
on top of that we then have faculty and
staff and there you don't want necessary
the students to be in the foreground so
we bring the working spaces the offices
to the forum and push the circulation
into the back of the building and that
becomes this tight spiral stair in the
back which brings you then up to the top
of the building which is then again the
junior and senior Commons room with a
big public roof terrace which I really
like like the library or like the lounge
or is juist the transparency of the
